intro: Marcgraviastrum delpinianum, commonly known as the Delpin's star vine, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and emits a mild fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
